Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2024
Author: MarilynneMarilynne
Title: A Pretty Cup
Body: OK! I buckled and finally purchased a Stanley Cup. I’m normally purchase Yeti cups, but I heard so many raven reviews about the Stanley Cup until I decide to go ahead and get one.Needless to say, I prefer the Yeti cup in comparison to the Stanley Cup. The Stanley Cup is fashionable, pretty, looks nice with different outfits however, it leaks, scratches and dents easily, and the handle starts to wiggle after about three weeks of use.Being a teacher, I try to make sure I drink at least 64 ounces of water a day so this particular 40 ounce cup helped me to be able to drink that amount of water and some throughout the day while teaching. However, I was disappointed to see that when a student happened to knock it down on the floor it actually scratched off the paint and dented. I also noticed After roughly one month, the ice occasionally stayed frozen 11 hours and on some days, the ice melted in two to three hours inside an air condition building. So I’m not quite sure as to why on some days it would stay cold and on other days it would not. But the inconsistency is noted.Overtime the handle seems to be coming loose and when caring it in a Stanley designer carrying bag, the liquid in the cup actually leaks out of the top while hanging right side up off your shoulder. So the cup is not leak proof and will get the side of your clothes wet while you’re carrying it on your shoulder. Therefore, that is why I am rating this cup at a level three and not at least at level four.Now, for those who are die hard, Stanley Cup collectors don’t not purchase your Stanley Cup just based off of this review. However, if you are person like me who really needs a cup to do what it is advertised to do then this may not be the purchase you’re looking for.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2024
Author: Tim and StaceyTim and Stacey
Title: Poor customer service
Body: We purchased this item as a Mother’s Day gift and it arrived in Amazon packaging bag And not a box as others have mentioned. It was supposed to be a new product and not used however is far from this. We attempted to reach out to the customer service email through the Stanley store that we purchased it from which appeared to be authentic however, the email kept bouncing. We then went to the Stanley tools websites was noted to be the official website listed for the story and it was The Stanley tools company website and not the correct Stanley 1913. We finally got ahold of the correct store and heard from the customer service. They informed us that we need to return it now to the place we purchased the item however we are now outside the return policy. This process is not only been incredibly frustrating, but also embarrassing for us as it was supposed to be a gift!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2024
Author: Shy shyShy shy
Title: Sturdy but not leak proof
Body: Love the tumblr, very sturdy and great grip and weight isnt too heavy, but it leaks if tipped over and not just drops but will pour out if left tipped over, I think its because of the mouth spout on the top its not sealed properly. But if you keep it upright its great.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2024
Author: JMJM
Title: Looks Used
Body: Item looks used. I was expecting a new item in the original Stanley box, but received the cup simply wrapped in a plastic bag.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024
Author: katie johnsonkatie johnson
Title: came a little scuffed
Body: It’s a nice color and will surely work well as a water bottle, but i was disappointed to see that it was scuffed around the bottom of the wide part. I did try to wash it, hoping it was just dirt, but that did nothing. This came in a box with a boxed can cooler and some paper stuffing , but it wasn’t wrapped up in the paper or anything. It’s a water bottle so it’ll be beat up with time, but it’s a little disappointing that it arrived scuffed up.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2024
Author: juanjuan
Title: Product in Terrible Condition
Body: I am extremely disappointed with this purchase. The product arrived in Colombia in a deplorable state: dirty, scratched, and looking worse than even a one-dollar item from AliExpress. The quality of this product, from both Amazon and Stanley, is unacceptable.I expected much more from a company like Stanley and a large distributor like Amazon. Paying 45 bucks for an item in these conditions is frustrating, especially when considering the hassle and stress of returning it. This experience has seriously damaged my trust in Amazon and the Stanley brand.**Conclusion:** I do not recommend purchasing this product or trusting its quality.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2024
Author: I am Heinz Getwellvet
Title: Not As Advertised, Do not be fooled by the HYPE!!!!!!!!
Body: 1. This cup leaks no matter if the straw is in or out. 2. This cup does not stop the ice from melting compared to cups that are half this price. This cup is advertised to keep the ice for ..2 days? or 11 hours cold...whatever that means. Either way it does neither!! My ice melts pretty quick indoors and the drink does not stay cold like ANY of my bubba cups. (unfortunately I could not find a 40oz bubba that is not plastic.  I am going to order a 40oz hemli cup ($21) to compare the two. For $45 dollars this cup is a rip-off. The hype is just through advertising and I for one was fooled. Theres no way a cup that cost this much should leak or melt ice that quick. My loss.

Author: Kaelyn pKaelyn p
Title: Mixed feelings
Body: Ordered less than 1 week ago. First time Stanley purchase… I was SUPER excited. Product arrived and I immediately washed/filled it up. The next day, ice was still in my cup so in that aspect- it’s amazing! I did notice it leak in my car though because it wasn’t all the way upright.I went outside with my kids, set it on the ground to play. It got tipped over (again, on the ground) and damaged the lid. I figured for as much as you pay, it’d be a bit more durable so I’m disappointed in that.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024
Author: Adolfo PazAdolfo Paz
Title: Scuffed product
Body: This cup showed up scuffed up despite being well boxed, so I suspect it happened prior to boxing. Some scuffs are pretty visible, others are too small for picture but still disappointing nonetheless.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
Author: riri
Title: Broken upon arrival
Body: The cup overall is in good shape, the color, and everything else is nice but the straw arrived broken and unable to be used. I don’t want to go through the entire return process and can simply buy a new straw so I’ll do that. After speaking with Stanley’s support team we came to the conclusion that it’s a shipping issue and not a problem on their end but something i have to take up with amazon.Truly heartbroken to say the least but I’d rather skip the process as a whole.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2024
Author: April
Title: I like this but....
Body: I just recieved my $45.00 Stanley Cup from Amazon. I opened the shipping box and my cup was wrapped with packaging paper (no box) I immediately noticed 2 small scuffs on the lower portion of the backside (see video) I would not have chosen this particular one, if I picked it off a store shelf. The inside was perfect and no damage to the straw. It is very sturdy and once I use it more I can review it's chill/heat factor. I like the color. It is heavy duty. Other than the 2 scuff marks would have been a better star review.

Title: No conserva el frío como debería. Creo que es copia
Body: Algo me dice que no es original realmente, no solo no viene en la caja oficial del producto, sino envuelto en papel, sino que no conserva el frío como debería. Supuestamente los hielos duran horas en el termo, pues en este no duran ni 20 minutos. Creo que es una mala copia del original.

Author: MBDS
Title: Pretty but not worth it
Body: I’m very confused about all the hype about this cup. I was so excited and I’m disappointed.It’s very pretty and the handle is great! These are the only two things I like about my Stanley.It leaks! It doesn’t matter what you do. I bought a leak proof set from a third party company and it does help but you have to really suck on the straw and I drink a lot of water so it’s not fun.I prefer my non brand cup and it’s half of the price.

Title: It leaks

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2024
Author: Caleigh
Title: Great product, but came slightly scuffed and dented which was disappointing.
Body: I’ve had this bottle before and it’s super durable and I love the handle - makes it so easy to carry around. Only problem is that with this specific purchase, the product came damaged. It’s not worth the energy to return it, but I’m assuming someone else returned it prior to me after dropping it, as it’s scuffed and has a dent. Just not as satisfying… having a new water bottle that arrived imperfect 🤷‍♀️

Author: Alexander Clayton Schmalensee
Title: Nice, but leaks
Body: Cute and trendy cup, but it leaks a lot so I would recommend getting the one with the flippy straw and the handle on the top.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2024
Author: cstan71cstan71
Title: Doesn't keep cold and customer service is horrible.
Body: Within 20 minutes, the entire outside is dripping with condensation and ice is completely melted after 1 - 2 hours.  I also think the 40oz size is too large for my liking and clunky to hold.Figured I got a lemon and was expecting their customer service to be top notch given the premium price they charge for these things...boy was I in for a surprise.  Put in a warranty claim three months after my purchase and I got a notice requesting 2 pictures of the item and they immediately cancelled the service ticket.  Put in another ticket and at first I got a noticed that my claim was approved and they were sending my replacement.  Then I get an email that said they needed 3 pictures, which included the 2 that I had given them (quite confusing).  Replied with the 3rd picture, and then I got a notice that my claim was again cancelled.Come on Stanley!  This is ridiculous.  It shouldn't be as hard as they are making it.  Maybe that is their strategy, be difficult until people just give up.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2024
Author: Fatima ValenciaFatima Valencia
Title: Loved the Stanley but…
Body: The tumbler was damaged, people will probably say its small scratches and barely noticeable, but as someone with OCD, i cannot keep my eyes away from those marks…. I really loved the tumbler, and the overnight shipping was wonderful, but i just can’t keep this damaged tumbler. I have started the process to get a replacement, and hopefully its not damaged….

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Lead in their base!
Body: I bought one of these, wanting to know what the hype was all about.  I do like the lid design!  I decided to do some research on a product and is BPA free, but almost all Stanley thermals have a small amount of lead in their base.Needless to say, this is going back to Amazon.

Date: Starter Plan or higher is required in order to access reviews beyond 100.
